timeline.message:
Issue #4713 Async dispatch with query.

+ Preserve the entire URI with query when startAsync(req,res) is used.
+ merge any query string from dispatch path with either original query or preserved query from forward

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>

Issue #4713 asyncDispatch with query parameters

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>

Issue #2074 Do not merge query strings

Do not merge the query string itself, only the parameter map.
The query string is either the original or replaced by the one from the dispatch.

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Previously, if there was no new queryString, the mergedQueryParams would be set to NO_PARAMS. Is this change intentional? Does the code handle the case where the mergedQueryParams are now null whereas before they were an empty MultiMap? Is there a test specifically for this?
Other than this, LGTM.
timeline.author: janbartel

replies.bodyText: That code change was because newQueryParams can never be null here because the if clause 4 lines early is newQueryParams == null ||
replies.author: gregw
